Material used.Description: αSyn proteins were expressed and purified as described.

Readout description.Result Description: No significant difference in degradation rate compared to wildtype; produces similar N-terminal fragments.
Degraded more rapidly than wildtype, with a distinct fragmentation pattern producing the 1-73 fragment early.
No significant difference in degradation rate compared to wildtype; produces similar N-terminal fragments.

Basic negative control.Description: Reactions performed with 20S proteasome preincubated with the inhibitor MG132.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Degradation pattern similar to wildtype αSyn with fragments 1-110 and 1-83 predominant.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Degradation pattern differing from wildtype, with rapid turnover or distinct fragment patterns such as early 1-73 fragment.

Experiment Method.Assay Method: Thioflavin T Fluorescence Assay for Fibrillization

Material used.Description: 500 μL reactions of 100 μM αSyn were prepared as previously described.

Readout description.Result Description: Slightly longer lag phase for fibrillization compared to wildtype; not significantly affected by liposomes.
Forms amyloid fibrils earlier and elongates faster than wildtype; lag phase lengthened by liposomes.
Forms amyloid fibrils earlier and elongates faster than wildtype; lag phase lengthened by liposomes.

Technical replicates.Description: The aggregation reaction was performed in triplicate in microtiter plates.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Lag time for fibril initiation similar to wildtype αSyn as measured by Thioflavin T fluorescence exceeding twice the noise level.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Lag time for fibril initiation significantly shorter or longer than wildtype αSyn as measured by Thioflavin T fluorescence.

Material used.Description: 650 μL reactions containing 100 μM αSyn were prepared as for the fibrillization reactions.

Readout description.Result Description: Oligomers observed only when both 20S proteasome and liposomes are present.
Readily forms oligomers in the presence of 20S, liposomes, or both.
Readily forms oligomers in the presence of 20S, liposomes, or both.

Technical replicates.Description: Data from three independent experiments were quantitated and averaged.

Basic positive control.Description: Recombinant C-terminal truncations of αSyn (αSyn119 and αSyn110) were used to validate the assay.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Data normalized to a range of 0-1, mean and standard deviation calculated.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Oligomer formation similar to wildtype αSyn, with low levels detected only under specific conditions (both 20S and liposomes present).

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Accelerated oligomer formation compared to wildtype αSyn, detected under various conditions.
